function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["Suboptimal data science literacy in the health sector","Lack of regulatory frameworks for data protection","Delays in authorization of clinical trials and studies by national regulatory bodies","Difficulties in engaging hospitals to participate in observational studies","General lack of consensus in the interpretation of the general data protection regulation gdpr","Sharing of highly sensitive health data","Lack of interoperability of heterogeneous health-related data","Constraints of sharing and utilizing sensitive health data","Lack of neighborhood social capital limits access to healthcare and information, contributing to disease factors and exacerbating stress.","Discovery of virus with genomic similarity to sars-cov-2 raises concerns about potential for human transmission.","Increase in pandemics over the 20th century","Link between climate change and infectious diseases","Peri-urbanization of industrial agriculture in the global south","Higher disease burden in specific subsets of urban populations in the global south","Intensified animal rearing and complex commodity ’webs’ in the global south","Domination of techno-scientific concepts over politico-economic factors in delineating causal factors for disease transmission","Inequity in access to basic infrastructure and exposure to environmental contamination","Spatial segregation of socioeconomic groups leading to disproportionate exposure to environmental toxins and pollutants","Neighborhood-scale inequities in access to social resources leading to health disparities","Inability to untangle the complexities of multi-factorial pathways through which planning impacts urban health","Impact of urbanization on zoonoses in the global south","Lack of redundancy in critical supply chains and services","Vulnerability to zoonotic disease emergence","Inadequate social adaptive capacity to respond to disturbances","Urban expansion encroaches on wildlife habitat, creating wuis. human activities in these ’buffer zones’ create stress for wild animals, facilitating viral shedding.","Reduced biodiversity depletes the possibility of alternate hosts for disease transmission.","Animal rearing creates a risk of domesticated animals acting as intermediate hosts for viruses to evolve and infect humans.","Lack of universal access to critical infrastructures increases susceptibility to disease transmission.","Centralized environmental quality improvement is needed to reduce stresses that exacerbate the impact of shocks.","Zoonotic disease emergence and interspecific disease transmission","Family of super spreaders causing second wave of infections","Reliance on community volunteers for disaster response","Transfer of surveillance data management to a u.s. consultancy","Lack of adaptive governance leading to ineffective response to the pandemic","Weak social capital and lack of trust in the community","Inadequate decentralization of control in healthcare systems","Panic buying behavior during crises","Inadequate disaster response planning","Inadequate redundancy in production lines or supply chains may lead to disruptions in crucial product availability during a contagious disease outbreak.","Inadequate redundancy in data gathering and monitoring systems for covid-19 may result in incomplete or delayed information about hotspots and infected areas, leading to uncontrolled spread of the disease.","Inadequate redundancy in food supply chains may lead to shortages and hoarding behavior, exacerbating the impact of contagious diseases on vulnerable populations.","Persistence of pathogens or vectors in soil, water, and pollutants","Healthcare product shortages in high-income nations","Dependence on global commodity chains with low cost, just-in-time inventory, and specialized divisions of labor","Contaminated water sources provide breeding grounds for disease-carrying mosquitoes, increasing the risk of malaria and dengue transmission.","Air pollution, including particulate matter and other pollutants, has been linked to increased severity and transmission of covid-19.","Superspreading events leading to majority transmission of covid-19","High population density facilitating disease transmission","Lockdowns reducing community transmission but halting economic activity","Lack of housing leading to overcrowding, increasing contact rate and disease transmission","Lack of clean water access leading to inability to practice proper hygiene and handwashing","Open defecation and lack of sanitation leading to fecal-oral transmission of pathogens","Inequalities exacerbating the disease burden for vulnerable populations","Infrastructure inequities enhance host susceptibility and can facilitate transmission","Limited contact tracing and isolation may lead to unchecked virus transmission","Population susceptibility to infection is influenced by biological traits and environmental factors","Underfunding of global surveillance of viruses capable of transmission to humans","Human settlement and activity increase human-wildlife interfaces and facilitate interspecific pathogen transmission","Infrastructure inequities enhance host susceptibility and can facilitate disease transmission","Habitat encroachment and fragmentation leading to increased wildlife-urban interfaces","Zoonotic diseases originating from wildlife and domestic animals","Conditions in peri-urban areas and highly urbanized centers favoring emergence of infectious diseases","Zoonotic viruses causing disease outbreaks through interspecific transmission from wild animals to humans","Viral shedding and mutation due to human disturbances to habitats and animal hosts"]}
